abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Economic Recovery Credit (ERC) in the
            Republic of Chad. The Economic Recovery Credit sought to
            support the post-devaluation reform program as outlined in
            the Government's Statement of Economic and Social
            Policy. Program implementation was overall satisfactory,
            although insufficient initial commitment to reforms and
            weaknesses in administration caused disappointing results in
            the first half of 1994. Program results were overall
            satisfactory. To the joint credit of the Bank and the
            Chadian Government, however, actions were taken in the
            second part of 1994 to remedy the short comings observed
            earlier. The ERC implementation record suggests that
            successful program implementation hinges on the existence
            of: (i) strong commitment from the top; (ii) appropriate
            institutions and mechanisms to monitor progress and
            implement reforms; and (iii) broad support from the civil society.
